runs.comm: starts with one on the pads and Tamim picks up a single to long leg
shortish, very wide, Sarkar has to reach out and can't put bat to ball. Not called wide, for some reason
back of a length outside off, comes on very slow. I think Sarkar wanted to slap it through the off side, ended up dragging it between the bowler and mid-off
down the track and Abbott greets him with a short ball. Not much width but he slashes hard and the ball flies away between the keeper and AB at wide slip
down the track again and this time the short ball is at his body, following him. Jabs at it, trying to poke it into the leg side, and it goes between bat and body to the keeper
short down the leg side and Tamim lets it go through to the keeper for a wide, making sure his bat and body are firmly out of the way
gone! It's another short ball down the leg side and Tamim, looking to pull, only manages to glove it to the keeper
length ball, straightens towards leg stump. Sarkar usually stays next to the line, looking to play through the off side, and it cramps him and forces him to defend towards mid-on
length ball on off stump and Sarkar goes after it and juuuust manages to clear the leaping Wiese at mid-on. Taking on the tallest player on the field, and just about succeeding
length ball on off stump and Sarkar throws his bat at it again, looking to go over mid-off maybe. Slices it high over cover, squarer than he liked, but it falls into no-man's land
in the blockhole close to off stump, jabbed away to backward point
Two down. Bouncer, rising sharply over Sarkar's left shoulder. He was in an awkward position to pull, and ended up hitting under it and finding the man at deep square leg
back of a length on leg stump, tucked away towards square leg
back of a length on off stump, Shakib gets nicely behind to defend back to the bowler
back of a length, close to off stump, nicely steered by Shakib, rolling his wrists over on top of the bounce, down to third man
full outside off, gets forward and plays a checked drive to cover
fullish on middle and leg, whipped away to deep square leg
shortish, whipped off the hips towards square leg
back of a length close to off stump, dabbed away to third man
on the pads, clipped to short midwicket
back of a length, tucked off the hips to the left of square leg
length ball outside off, gets his weight forward nicely to push to mid-off
length ball on middle stump, tucked away to the right of short fine leg

shot! Down the track, makes a bit of room, and even though Rabada followed him with the full ball, he stayed still, head right over the ball, and used his wrists to drive powerfully between the bowler and mid-off
length ball outside off, comes forward and defends towards point
back of a length, angling into off stump. Shakib backs away and chops it towards point
full-toss outside off, clubbed down the ground and mid-on slides to his right to stop it
shortish on middle and off, clubbed away to deep square leg
short ball and Mushfiqur is nicely over it, swivels on his toes to pull to deep square leg
full-toss on off stump, swiped to mid-on, didn't really middle it
full on off stump and Shakib smacks it away, clearing his front leg and hitting through the line to beat mid-off, diving to his left
back of a length outside off, chopped away down to third man
slower ball on middle and leg, Shakib goes down on one knee and plays an ungainly sweep-pull towards short fine leg
back of a length, angling in towards off stump. Makes room to cut and it keeps a bit low, ends up chopping it down towards point
another slower ball outside off and he was initially looking to slog that over the leg side, ended up checking himself, letting it come on, and pushing it softly to point
a bit fuller and straighter and he clears his front leg to lift it over mid-on. Didn't quite middle it but he knew there was no one in the deep, picks up two for his effort
length ball on middle stump, shuffles across and tucks it away to the left of short fine leg
and that's sharp turn straightaway. Lovely flight outside off and it beats the outside edge of Mushfiqur, coming forward to defend
shot! This was straighter in line and Mushfiqur moved his front leg out of the way to chip inside-out, with the spin, over cover, and manages to beat long-off diving desperately to his left
looks for the sweep from outside off, ends up dragging it into his own feet
slow, back of a length, goes back and across to tuck it away towards square leg
big appeal for caught behind as the ball keeps low to go under Shakib's attempted pull from outside off. De Kock thinks there's an inside edge but there's none

clean strike, and that's the first six of the innings. Down the track, and just an easy, free swing of the arms to send it soaring over the leaping man at deep midwicket. Hit it with the turn, and the line, just outside off, gave him lots of hitting room
on the pads and he calls for a single after tucking it towards square leg. Sent back by Shakib
back of a length on the pads and he works it to the left of backward square leg
short, a bit of width, steered away to the right of sweeper cover
back of a length, plenty of width, but Mushfiqur can't beat backward point with his cut
down the track and that's a soft dismissal. Duminy saw him coming and fired it at his pads. Mushfiqur whipped it in the air, and only managed to pick out the man at deep midwicket
dangled up slow outside off, driven down to long-on with the turn
shortish and wide, but it keeps very low and sneaks under Sabbir's attempted cut
a little closer to off stump and he looks for the late cut now. Turn and bounce and the top edge loops in the air through the vacant region to the right of backward point
fuller now, driven down to long-off
down the track and that's well bowled by Phangiso, held his length back and got it to turn sharply and strike Shakib on the pad as he stretched out to defend
turn again from outside off, Sabbir presses out to work it down the ground, and it goes off the leading edge into the off side
straighter line now, defended back to the bowler
down the track, checked drive to short cover

what a catch that is! Saw Sabbir shaping for the reverse sweep and began moving to the right and he was in the perfect position when the ball came straight at him, off the batsman's gloves. It hit his left thigh and he just about managed to hang on while falling to the floor, with his hands bunched together at his stomach
sharp turn from outside off and Nasir goes on the back foot to work it away through square leg
tossed up outside off and it turns away sharply to beat Shakib's defensively thrust bat
whoa, again. This time the length pinned Shakib to the crease, and he was in a terrible position, simply hanging his bat out as it turned and bounced past the edge
fuller now, on middle and off, defended towards short cover

Five down. It's tossed up outside off and that isn't the greatest of shots from Nasir. Went for the drive, throwing his hands at the ball without getting his head over it, and hit it uppishly, straight to short cover
nicely flighted outside off, comes forward for the checked drive into the covers
straighter now and he comes on the front foot to clip it away through midwicket
length ball on off stump, swept away towards deep backward square leg
nice flight again from Phangiso, outside off, draws Litton forward and spins it away to take his edge as he looks to defend. Soft hands meant it fell short of slip
straighter now, on middle stump, swept firmly to deep square leg. He plays that shot well, does Litton.
tossed up outside off, driven with the turn towards long-on
stays back to a fullish ball on off stump, stays inside the line to dab it towards backward point. Dangerous with the amount of turn Duminy has been getting
down the track now, gets to the pitch to drive to long-off
short outside off, Litton makes room to cut. Sharp turn to cramp the batsman but he adjusts and dabs it cleverly, fine, to the right of the keeper
short again, a bit more width, chopped towards short cover
short once again and Litton makes room once again. Sharp turn and he inside-edges it onto de Kock's thigh. Would have been another sensational catch had he managed to grab that on the bounce
down the track comes Shakib and he slogs it with the turn towards long-on, who nearly catches it running in and diving forward. Fell just short of him
goes for the sweep now and that's another unconvincing shot, ball bounces a bit more and he top-edges it in the air, to the left of the man at deep backward square leg
slow flight outside off and he comes forward, front foot inside the line, and plays a chip drive towards sweeper cover
tossed up again and he clears his front leg to slog-sweep from outside off. Goes through without much turn and beats his inside edge
back of a length on off stump and he goes on the back foot to work it through midwicket

that looked like a pretty good appeal, strikes Shakib on the pads as he went for the reverse-sweep. Not given, may have been spinning past off stump. We'll have to see a replay. Yeah. Hit him on the thigh pad as well.
down the track and Wiese sends down the slower ball. Shakib miscues the big hit, bottom hand coming off the handle, and again it falls in no-man's land to the right of long-on

and that's the end of Shakib's troubled stay. Mid-off had gone back to long-off after the previous ball and fine leg had come into the circle. Looking to exploit that field change with the lap-sweep, Shakib ended up lapping the ball straight into short fine leg's hands
slower ball outside off. Mashrafe pokes forward to defend, can't put bat to ball
another slower ball, gets his front foot across to flick it from off stump towards midwicket
length ball on off stump, looks to dab it into the off side for a single but the man at point quickly attacks the ball to rule out that possibility
slower ball outside off, stretches across to work it towards deep midwicket
on the pads, flicked in the air, and that's super timing, nearly beats JP running to his right from deep midwicket, forces him to dive full-length and stop it with an outstretched right hand
slower ball and Litton saw that early, cleared his front leg to make swinging room and easily cleared the fielder at long-on
back of a length on middle stump, tucked away to midwicket
short ball, and that is dismissive from Mashrafe. Stands tall and pulls, off the front foot, to the midwicket boundary
short again but the line is outside off and Mashrafe can't control the pull as well. Effort ball too, extra bounce, and he top-edges it and AB takes a simple catch at deep midwicket
length ball outside off, Litton presses forward and guides it down to third man to keep the strike
back of a length outside off, chopped down towards short third man
skips out of his crease, clips it from off stump down to long-on
sharp turn in from outside off. Gazi was looking to drive through the off side first, changed his mind and looked to whip it through midwicket, ended up inside-edging into his pads
tossed up wide outside off, beats Gazi's attempt at a slog-sweep
quicker now, back of a length outside off, dabbed gently to short third man
tossed up outside off, Litton goes for the reverse-sweep, mindful of third man being inside the circle, but there's sharp turn and bounce and can't make contact, ball pops up off the flap of his pad
dug in short, rises sharply towards the left shoulder, jumps in the air to defend into the on side
another short ball, controls the pull well down to deep square leg
back of a length outside off, dabbed away fine but can't beat short third man, Phangiso, who dives to his left to make the stop
down the track comes Gazi. Parnell follows with a full ball angloed into his feet and he drives it in the air towards long-on
bouncer, dug in very short, and Litton can't connect with the hook
slower bouncer, and Litton has to wait for it to come on to help it to short fine leg

full slower ball outside off and Litton shuffles across to whip it towards square leg. Gazi scurries out of his crease even though the ball went straight to the fielder, and Litton sent him back. Doesn't beat the throw in from AB and Wiese completes the run-out comfortably
moves a long way across to whip the ball from wide outside off. Was looking to go over short fine leg but he can't get the elevation, rolls down to the fielder
slower ball wide outside off, too wide, and Litton leaves it alone
slower length ball outside off and he moves across again to sweep, ends up top-edging and AB - he's been everywhere today - takes it well, moving backwards from square leg
slower ball on the pads, tucked away through square leg
on the pads again, clipped away to the right of short fine leg
back of a length outside off, dabbed away to backward point
slower short ball outside off, backs away to steer it to third man and can't put bat to ball
makes room again and he follows him with a short ball on middle stump. Chops it down towards point
very short, and it rises very high. Mustafizur has to reach a long way over his shoulder to try and connect as he backs away. Not called wide.
back of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot into the off side
makes room to carve through the off side and Parnell finishes the game with a yorker, smacks into off stump after squeezing under Mustafizur's bat
